sub_title: Chemical Engineer, Commissioning, Safety and Management.
summary:
A Successful engineer, whom can solves problems, develops & creates optimal solutions, gains experience from other fields of engineering and management.

To summarize my background; I studied chemical engineering in English in KAU University, Jeddah, K.S.A. In the final semester, I got my training in ARAMCO as a coop - trainee. 

I have been worked as a safety engineer in saudi bin laden group construction company. Also I have been worked in petrofac and hyundai companies as a process engineer. 

Then I had an opportunity to be a member of Gaia 3.0 Program Madrid, Spain with a scholarship and with this program I started my latest master of Professional Development and also now I am gaining the experience of working in a Spanish company, Tecnicas Reunidas, as a commissioning engineer.

I have gained a good management experience by working as an Operations & Safety Manager at Tanajib company, now I looking for a new position so I can apply what have learned in my career.

Project Details :Jazan Refinery Project - EPC 10 & 11 , Client - Saudi Aramco

Hydro-cracker unit and Hydro-treater unit . The refinery will produce around 400,000 barrels of oil per day and have associated terminal facilities on the Red Sea near Jazan.

1) Develop safety procedures to be employed by workers operating equipment or working in close proximity to on-going chemical reactions.

2) Determine most effective arrangement of operations, such as mixing, crushing, heat transfer, distillation, and drying.

3) Prepare estimate of production costs and production progress reports for management.

4) Direct activities of workers who operate or who are engaged in constructing and improving absorption, evaporation, or electromagnetic equipment.

5) Perform laboratory studies of steps in manufacture of new product and test proposed process in small scale operation (pilot plant).
